author: Soumyadip Maity
contents: This is the first part of my getting started in linux series. This series is specially made for Linux beginners. The information in this series can be applied to any Linux distribution based on Ubuntu and Debian, like, ZorinOS, Linux Mint, Linux Mint Debian Edition, PopOs, etc. Here, I am going to use ZorinOS for this series. Here, I am going to show you how to make a bootable usb stick of ZorinOS.
title: Get started in Linux-1

author: Katheryn Fox
contents:
Written in Go, Hugo is an open source static site generator available under the Apache Licence 2.0.Hugo supports TOML, YAML and JSON data file types, Markdown and HTML content files and uses shortcodes to add rich content. Other notable features are taxonomies, multilingual mode, image processing, custom output formats, HTML/CSS/JS minification and support for Sass SCSS workflows.
Hugo makes use of a variety of open source projects including:
https://github.com/yuin/goldmarkhttps://github.
title: About Me
